column5: found this rod while surfing the net last night  It does not look like any of the Sheffield rods I have seen in stores  Any comments on this rod?  http://www.fishusa.com/tackleshop/catalog_...B6BA46&fx=1
The reviews don't look very promising.

Never fished with a sheffield but I do have a lower model as a beater rod for floating salmon when there is nothing else to do. It fishes like a 13 foot piece of wet spaghetti...that said I HAVE landed a ton of fish (salmon and steelhead) on it without and problems.  Its probably heavy, and probably suffers from tip sag, but you get what you pay for.
for $200 I would buy a St.Croix Wild River Monday, Tuesday , and twice on Wednesday .... Okuma Steelhead gear is bottom of the barrel . Makes good backup gear....new Sirata included
For $230 I BUILT one.  and I love it...mostly because I built it.  St croix rods are a good choice if you are not looking to break the bank on a float rod. Its no IMX but hey, it does the job
thanks for the input  was looking for comments from people who have used it
Okuma rod=Garbage... Buy a st croix.
My condolences to anyone who spent 2 bills on this thing..... OK OK im done bashing now
